subject: ADDENDUM: Multiple frontends share this backend — route changes break both apps
body:
Fulton,

Critical addition to my previous message.

Remember: we have MULTIPLE frontends hitting the same backend:
- TangoTiempo (appId=1) — my app
- HarmonyJunction (appId=2) — Chord's app

Both frontends call the same API routes. If AF changes the route shape from what calendar-be had (e.g., /api/events/post becomes /api/calendars/{calendarId}/events), you break BOTH apps, not just one.

This is why the BE-to-AF migration must be a 1:1 route match. The backend is a shared service. We cannot have each frontend rewrite their API calls to match a new AF route design. The AF routes must mirror the old BE routes exactly.

CC'ing Chord so they're aware of this gap too.

Sarah
